publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3136 Donald Gorrie: Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk-That the Parliament congratulates British Waterways, Falkirk Council and all the organisations and people who contributed to the creation and building of the Falkirk Millennium Wheel, which is a testament to Scotland's well-renowned and innovative engineering skills. and welcomes Her Majesty the Queen, who will officially open the Wheel on 24 May 2002, and whose presence is an indication of the significance of this imaginative project as a new landmark in central Scotland.
S1M-3136 Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk (lodged on 20 May 2002) Robert Brown*

S1M-3136 Donald Gorrie: Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk—That the Parliament congratulates British Waterways, Falkirk Council and all the organisations and people who contributed to the creation and building of the Falkirk Millennium Wheel, which is a testament to Scotland’s well-renowned and innovative engineering skills. and welcomes Her Majesty the Queen, who will officially open the Wheel on 24 May 2002, and whose presence is an indication of the significance of this imaginative project as a new landmark in central Scotland. Supported by: Robert Brown
S1M-3136 Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk (lodged on 20 May 2002) Iain Smith*
S1M-3136 Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk (lodged on 20 May 2002) Alex Neil*
S1M-3136 Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk (lodged on 20 May 2002) Cathie Craigie*
S1M-3136 Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk (lodged on 20 May 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3136 Royal Opening of Millennium Wheel, Falkirk (lodged on 20 May 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*
